com.st.st25sdk.command

Interface Iso14443SRCustomCommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Iso14443SRCustomCommand

    public interface Iso14443SRCustomCommandInterface

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void completion()
      After receiving the completion() command, any ST Iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state transitions to the DEACTIVATED state and stops decoding any new command.
      byte[] getUid()
      Asks the SELECTED ST Iso14443SR-type tag for its 8-byte UID (transmitted LSB first).
      byte initiate()
      initiate() is used to initiate the anticollision sequence of the ST Iso14443SR-type tag.
      byte pCall16()
      After receiving the pCall16() command, the ST Iso14443SR-type tag generates a new random chip slot number value.
      byte[] readBlock(byte blockAddress)
      Reads the desired memory blocks of the ST iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state.
      void resetToInventory()
      After receiving the resetToInventory() command, all ST Iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state revert to the INVENTORY state.
      byte select(byte chipID)
      The select(chipID) command moves the targeted ST Iso14443SR-type tag into the SELECTED state.
      byte slotMarker(byte slotNumber)
      After receiving the slotMarker(slotNumber) command, the ST Iso14443SR-type tag compares the 4 least significant bits of its chipID to slotNumber.
      void writeBlock(byte blockAddress, byte[] buffer)
      Writes the four bytes of buffer at address blockAddress of the SELECTED ST Iso14443SR-type tag (provided that the block is available and not write-protected).

    • Method Detail

      • initiate

        byte initiate()
       throws STException
        initiate() is used to initiate the anticollision sequence of the ST Iso14443SR-type tag. On receiving the initiate() command, all devices in Ready state switch to the INVENTORY state, set a new 8-bit chipId random value, and return their Chip_ID value. This command is useful when only one tag in Ready state is present in the reader field range. It speeds up the Chip_ID search process.
        Returns:
        chipId 8-bit random number returned by the only tag in the RF field
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • pCall16

        byte pCall16()
      throws STException
        After receiving the pCall16() command, the ST Iso14443SR-type tag generates a new random chip slot number value. A slotNumber is defined as the 4 least significant bites of the chipId - value between 0 and 15. If this slotNumber value = 0b000, the tag returns its chipID value. If slotNumber != 0b0000, the tag doesn't answer. When used with the slotMarker() command, pCall16() allows the reader to search for all the chipIDs of tags present in the RF field.
        Returns:
        chipID 8-bit random number returned by the tag that responds in slot 0
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • slotMarker

        byte slotMarker(byte slotNumber)
         throws STException
        After receiving the slotMarker(slotNumber) command, the ST Iso14443SR-type tag compares the 4 least significant bits of its chipID to slotNumber. If they match, the tag returns its chipID. If not, the tag doesn't answer. The anti-collision sequence starts with the pCall16() command, then sends slotMarker(slotNumber) commands, varying slotNumber from 1 to 15 and collecting tag chipIds in the process. This anticollision sequence is repeated until no collision is detected.
        Parameters:
        slotNumber - Only the 4 least significant bits are passed as parameter
        Returns:
        chipID 8-bit random number returned by the tag that responds in slot slotNumber
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • select

        byte select(byte chipID)
     throws STException
        The select(chipID) command moves the targeted ST Iso14443SR-type tag into the SELECTED state. Until the select() command is sent, the tag will only respond to initiate(), pCall16() and slotMarker() commands. When a ST Iso14443SR-type tag receives a select(chipID) command with a chipID that does not match its own, it moves into the DESELECTED state.
        Parameters:
        chipID - 8-bit random number
        Returns:
        chipID 8-bit random number returned by the SELECTED tag
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • completion

        void completion()
         throws STException
        After receiving the completion() command, any ST Iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state transitions to the DEACTIVATED state and stops decoding any new command. The tag moves out of the DEACTIVATED state only after it is removed from the RF field. Another ST Iso14443SR-type tag can then be accessed through a select() command without having to move the other tag from the RF field. Tags not in the SELECTED state ignore the completion() command.
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • resetToInventory

        void resetToInventory()
               throws STException
        After receiving the resetToInventory() command, all ST Iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state revert to the INVENTORY state. This command is useful when two ST Iso14443SR-type tags with the same cipID happen to be SELECTED at the same time. Forcing a new anticollision sequence allows the tags to generate new random chipIds. Tags not in the SELECTED state ignore the resetToInventory() command.
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • readBlock

        byte[] readBlock(byte blockAddress)
          throws STException
        Reads the desired memory blocks of the ST iso14443SR-type tag in the SELECTED state. Data bytes are transmitted with the least significant byte first. Tags that are not in the SELECTED state will not reply to the readBlock() command.
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Memory location to read. If blockAddress is bigger than the tag's memory capacity, the tag will not respond.
        Returns:
        4 data bytes contained in the desired memory block.
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • writeBlock

        void writeBlock(byte blockAddress,
                byte[] buffer)
         throws STException
        Writes the four bytes of buffer at address blockAddress of the SELECTED ST Iso14443SR-type tag (provided that the block is available and not write-protected). Data bytes to write must be transmitted with the least significant byte first. There is no tag response after a writeBlock() command. The reader must check that data was correctly programmed by reading the memory location after programming time tW defined in the datasheet. Tags that are not in the SELECTED state will not reply to the writeBlock() command.
        Parameters:
        blockAddress - Memory location to write. If blockAddress is bigger than the tag's memory capacity, the tag will not respond. The system area is located at address 255.
        buffer - 4-byte little endian data
        Throws:
        STException - STException

      • getUid

        byte[] getUid()
       throws STException
        Asks the SELECTED ST Iso14443SR-type tag for its 8-byte UID (transmitted LSB first). Tags that are not in the SELECTED state will not reply to the getUid() command.
        Returns:
        8-byte little-endian UID
        Throws:
        STException - STException
